journal-title-group.journal-title: Nebraska Journal of Economics and Business

publisher.publisher-name: College of Business Administration of the University of Nebraska-Lincoln

title-group.article-title: The Central American Common Market: Trade Patterns after a Decade of Union

p.mixed-citation: The influence of ECLA in formulating initial CACM objectives is explored in Roger D. Hansen, Central America: Regional Integration and Economic Development (Washington, D.C.: National Planning Association, 1967),
Joseph Pincus, The Central American Common Market (Guatemala City: Agency for International De- velopment, Regional Office for Central America and Panama, 1962).
Gunnar Myrdal, Development and Underdevelopment (National Bank of Egypt Fiftieth Anniversary Commemoration Lectures; Cairo: 1956)
J. R. Hicks, Essays in World Economics (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1959);
Ragnar Nurkse, "Trade Theory and Development Policy," in H. S. Ellis, ed., Economic Development for Latin America (New York: St. Martin's Press, 1961);
A. K. Cairncross, Factors in Economic Development (London: George Allen and Unwin, 1962).
Jack Baranson, "Industrialization and Regionalism in Central America," Inter- American Economic Affairs XVI, No. 2 (August, 1962), p. 87.

Cinco Años de Labores en la Integración Economica Centroamericana (Guate- mala City: Permanent Secretariat of Central American Integration, October 12, 1966), p. 10.
Wardlaw, loc. cit., p. 43.
The Inter-American Development Bank and the Economic Integration of Latin America (Washington, D.C.: Inter-American Development Bank, November, 1966), p. 7.
Convention Establishing the Central American Bank for Economic Integration, Article VIII, December 13, 1960.
Ibid., Article 21.
Report on Foreign Aid Loans Extended to Central America, 1961-1967, (Guatemala City: Agency for International Development, ROCAP, 1968).
ibid.

Donald McClelland, "The Common Market's Contribution to Central American Economic Growth-A First Approximation," submitted to the California Institute of International Studies Conference on the Economic Integration of Latin America, May 9, 1968, pp. 2, 36.
Robert Triffin, "Provisional Proposal for a Central American Stabilization Fund," presented to the Central American Monetary Council Meeting in San Jose, Costa Rica, 1968.

Balassa, "Trade Creation and Trade Diversion in the European Common Market," Economic Journal, March, 1967;

Tibor Scitovsky, Economic Theory and Western European Integration (Stanford: Stanford University Press, 1958).
Latin America see Alfredo Roldan, "The Latin American Economic Integration: Its Benefits and Obstacles," Nebraska Journal of Economics and Business 8, No. 1 (Winter, 1968-69), pp. 16-33.
